A4.text: The religious affiliation of the Israeli population as of 2022 was 73.6% Jewish, 18.1% Muslim, 1.9% Christian, and 1.6% Druze.

A5.text: Of the Arab Israelis, as of 2008, 82.7% were Muslims, 8.4% were Druze, and 8.3% were Christians.

A6.text: About 82 percent of the Arab population in Israel are Sunni Muslims

A7.text: In 2008, of Israel's 7.3 million people, 75.6 percent were Jews of any background

A8.text: Islam is the second largest religion in Israel, after Judaism.

A9.text: The Israeli government recognized the Druze community as an independent religious community in 1956 and again in 1963 formally as a Millet community within the meaning of the POC.
